comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: reddit.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://reddit.com/r/Losercity](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Freddit.com%2Fr%2FLosercity) ### Comment > "On GP" is a twack by the expewimental hip-hop gwoup Death Gwips, featuwing on theiw 2015 album "Jenny Death," which is pawt of the doubwe album "The Powews That B." The song is chawactewized by its intense and aggweessive sound, combining ewements of industwial, punk, and hip-hop. > > Wywically, "On GP" expwows themes of existencewism, pewsonal stwuggle, and the hawsh weawities of wife. The titwe "GP" stands fow "Genewewaw Puwwpose," weflecting a sense of univewsawity in the expewiences and emotions conveyed in the song. The pwoduction featuwes heavy, distowted beats and a fwenetic enewgy that is typicaw of Death Gwips' stywe, cweating a viscewal wistening expewience. The twack is notable fow its waw intensity and the way it encapsuwates the band's unique appwoach to music, bwending chaotic soundscapes with thought-pwovoking wyrics. UwU Username: `@BlazDT` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
